forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South wind around 8 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Drizzle then Light Rain Likely
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 4am, then rain likely. Cloudy, with a low around 53. East northeast wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the air hangs thick with the promise of a misty drizzle, cloaking the towering skyline with a softly diffused light that renders the cityscape into an impressionistic haze. Temperatures hover in the chilly mid-fifties, as a gentle south wind breathes life into the otherwise still air. The likelihood of rain increases as evening approaches, casting a shadow of gray over the landscape. The Golden Gate stands sentinel in the distance, likely cloaked by the creeping marine layer that often characterizes these winter afternoons.

As you step outside, consider wrapping yourself in a cozy layer, perhaps a light water-resistant jacket to fend off the anticipated drizzle and the chill that settles in as the sun makes its slow descent. Comfortable shoes will serve you well, whether you choose to take a contemplative stroll through one of the city’s fog-drenched parks or find solace in a quiet café, its windows fogged with the warmth of good coffee and warm pastries. As day gives way to night, the allure of this weather invites a retreat indoors or an embrace of the atmospheric charm that San Francisco so uniquely offers.
